title: Local build without CUDA fails on master:  undefined reference to `dlclose'
body_html:
Issue description

I am trying to build PyTorch without CUDA, but the build keeps failing. This is a log of the build process.

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source (on 1d4d9fc )
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): MAX_JOBS=3 NO_CUDA=1 python setup.py build
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2
  • Python version: 3.6 (Miniconda)
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4.0
  • CMake version: 3.11.3

Temporary fix:

If you are facing this issue too, please check this comment.

body:
## Issue description

I am trying to build PyTorch without CUDA, but the build keeps failing. [This](https://gist.github.com/vishwakftw/6ff0252793d333f2fead8286049c14c1) is a log of the build process.

## System Info
- PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source (on https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/1d4d9fc7da4c09c64fa276a47032291e3d0f77b6 )
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): `MAX_JOBS=3 NO_CUDA=1 python setup.py build`
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2
- Python version: 3.6 (Miniconda)
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4.0
- CMake version: 3.11.3

#### Temporary fix:
If you are facing this issue too, please check [this comment](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/9645#issuecomment-406824293).
